text: hey <!channel> i’m working on other projects today but am happy to help out on magnum if needed. Let me know if / how I can be of any help!
thanks melissa!
guys - ben just reached out with some ‘feedback’

using quotation marks here because i think by and large what he’s giving us feedback on can be changed in the CMS and this might be a good opportunity for us to show them how to make these changes and enter items into the cms

here’s what he wrote: 
- I noticed the front page takes lots of time to load, and was wondering if the thumbnail pictures could not be done in lower resolution)
- The country for Samar Hazboun is missing
- Would be good to space out a bit more between the dots for Lebanon and Palestine
- Eman Helal’s dot of Egypt is now in Mauritania
- Reem Falaknaz’ country should be UAE to keep it consistent with the others
<@U02618EV1>, do you have thoughts on the landing page load time/resolution question?
i haven’t experienced a problem with loading it. thinking it might be ben’s connection speed.
mauritania is my fault. :raised_hand: I should have let <@U026PLK4S> do the pins because apparently he’s really good at maps.
:simple_smile:
LOL
INSIDE JOKE GUYS
but hey, i just learned something. mauritania is right next to egypt
wow no it is not
i thought mauritania was a weed cocktail
haha
personally, i think we can do something about the first one without using smaller thumbs.
but i also don’t really know what i’m talking about, so take that with a grain of salt
yeah just like, optimize it or whatever

sure. or even as some smoke and mirror. i doubt it’s in best practice, but we have some VQA notes / examples of sites that “pre-load” (maybe not the right word), but provide a  loading animation / page / etc. It doesn’t make the photos load any quicker, but it does make the site feel polished and deliberate.
i’ll look and post. not saying we should do it, or add it, but maybe we can talk about it
sorry, my comment was a joke
dumb slack
aaaaah. yeah.
but agree on the smoke and mirror as a way to mitigate if we can’t do anything else

A couple of things, the original images are about 3 time bigger than the layout calls for. I think that after the mobile jambaroo we can come up with sizes for Jenny to add to the CMS. That in itself should help a bit.
oh nice.
The benefit of lazyloading (over preloading) is that the user can see something immediately instead of waiting for 10 big images to load.
are we preloading currently?
Nope
right. well, i don’t think this should derail us. i say keep the eyes on the prize. this stuff should wait until we’re ready for final polish. maybe we can talk more about it then
Agreed.
If we still think that may be an option, we should scope it out to get a sense for how long would take us to implement.

Awesome. That’s cool to hear.

I’m like 50/50 on lazy vs pre, personally. but just so everyone else can have some context, these are some examples of pre-loading that i collected. 

I bet when we optimize images, they’ll load fast enough to resolve the feedback, but if they don’t, maybe we can look into something like this:

<http://www.nicolasfleure.com/>
<http://thenouncollective.com/>
<http://www.wearehive.co.uk/>

attachments.text: We are hive, a London based studio designing digital products & services. -
attachments.fallback: We are hive, a London based studio designing digital products & services. -

text: those are nice examples

pretty minimal / tasteful, right? I had a handful more that were interesting, but pushed a little too far over the top.

<http://ecap.co.nz/>
<http://houseworx.co.nz/>
<http://workdiary.de/>

attachments.title: Michael Schmid - German Digital Designer & Developer
attachments.text: Michael Schmid is a German Digital Designer & Developer, focusing on Graphic Design and Web Design.
attachments.fallback: Michael Schmid - German Digital Designer & Developer

text: Interesting. I think you’re right, they’re a little heavy… but this is one of the few place on this site where we can be a little clever right? So I almost wonder if we could push it a bit. I think my personal fave is the Nicolas Fleure one. Anyway, I’m getting ahead of myself - we’ll see if we even need to resort to this. Hopefully the smaller asset size will just work.
<@U02613K0X> thoughts on having them make changes to the projects that they requested in the CMS?
i changed mauritania to egypt
i am more than happy to make the changes unless you’d like to use it as an opportunity to introduce the cms
Well, we're going to have to teach them how to use the CMS sometime. Not sure what the plan for doing that was, but functionally I see no problem with them using it whenever.
if you think now is fine it seems like a great opportunity to me
yeah seems like a good idea
We should make them a new CMS user account before giving them access
cool
can we copy their vimeo creds for ease?
Sure. I'll add the user in a min and let you know
thank you!
there were problems with the length of the username, so I went with username and pass of magnum and magnum2015
hope that works
can easily change either
(this user has been added to the staging/prod CMS, not dev)
can you send me the link to the staging/prod CMS?
<http://cms.staging.arabdocphotography.org/>
thank you!
That is staging and controls content of the staging site. When we launch production the url will change but that's all. Prod and staging use the same datastore.
theres a typo on the login page of the cms - admim instead of admin :simple_smile:
dang
sorry to be the typo person
admim has a nice ring to it
fixing now!
<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UNjkuHQGa2w>
:thumbsup:

<@U04JZANJF> do you know if we have ages for the artists? There's a spot in the designs for them to appear next to their location, but I haven't seen that info anywhere in stuff we've gotten from the client.
not sure if that should be a required item.
seems like it would just be a pain to keep updating...
yeah, it's not required, but there's a spot for it in the designs and to my knowledge we don't have it for anybody. is it something we'll ever get for anybody?
ha yeah
I'd rather not write a script that updates everyone's ages given their bday
:birthday:
we may want to change “REQUIRED ITEMS” to like…. “ARTIST INFO"
ok i'll make that change
thanks jenny

<!channel>: I wrote to Magnum president Susan Meiselas earlier today on another topic. She responded and added:

"VERY much like the work that Uncorked did for ADPP….elegant and essential!"

All caps are hers. And I'm going on record that if anybody was to be a harsh critic, it's her. She's wonderful, but direct. 

So...extra nice work, and a delight to get as part of an unprompted response. Go team!
Great to  hear. Thanks for sharing, David.
Love that critique. Very encouraging, couldn't agree more — great work team!
